comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: It really is a stunning work of art, look at that detail, brilliant.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: It is fantabulous. This is the WEST face - full details of the carvings here - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Muiredach's_High_Cross#West-face . It is fascinating and shocking to see how much has eroded in 150 years with the wikipedia hi-res photo - upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e9/Muiredach%27s...

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] That's what struck me on the relief of the carving. Think of all the weathering by wind and rain and frost and pollution since this photo was taken 150-ish years ago...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 59302818@N00
comment._content: Although it was around eight hundred years old when the photo was taken in the 1860s the cross still looked comparatively new.  Just goes to show the pollution that has occurred over the past hundred plus years.  Industrial revolution and all that.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/crexcrex] Absolutely!

comment.author: 77848526@N06
comment._content: Don't forget the alternate angle published by John Finerty in his superb "Ireland in Pictures" in the 1890s, kindly on display in an American university: www.quinnipiac.edu/other/abl/etext/irish/pictures203/p31.... The full index is also worth checking out. www.quinnipiac.edu/other/abl/etext/irish/pictures203/irel...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Amazed by the StreetView how undeveloped this place still is - not a Coca-Cola sign in sight! Take a virtual walk around via YouTube - youtu.be/VgzW_X0KcMY . Is there any information about the palely loitering character? He looks as if he is about to .... !

comment.author: 44191635@N04
comment._content: excellent shot

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] I see from other photos in the series that the Loiterer was joined by a Leprechaun! eg - catalogue.nli.ie/Record/STP_2878/Image?lookfor=http://www... . Or is it all in my imagination?

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] You can view the stereo effect by using the "Cross-Eyed" method (technical term). The Leprechaun stood still but one of the crosses moved. I used to take 3D using one camera, moving it 2 inches sideways between exposures. I then went on to having 2 identical cameras fixed on a frame to capture moving objects. www.flickr.com/groups/stereo/

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] You made us roar laughing here in our dungeon at Library Towers! Though of course, Leprechauns are no laughing matter. Wouldn't dream of poking fun at them, just in case!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Those Leprechauns have a habit of hiding behind moving gravestones and jump out at the most inconvenient times!  I gave up courting in our local graveyard for just that reason.  [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] Poking fun at the little people is dangerous stuff Carol, your "Towers" could come tumbling down about your ears, so they could.  Well done BB  that was a great find altogether!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Couldn't resist! The Little People made me do it... :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] From the sublime to the ridiculous! [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] My Irish mother told me not to do cross-eyed - the wind might change and I would stay like that. There is a fellow here on Flickr [http://www.flickr.com/photos/7726011@N07/] Thiophene_Guy, who turns old stereoviews into .gif images using a freeware program. Interesting stuff, eg - www.flickr.com/photos/7726011@N07/7547466708/
